scripts.title: Wacky Waving

lines.text: Wacky Waving Inflatable Arm Flailing Tube Man! Wacky Waving Inflatable Arm Flailing Tube Man! Wacky Waving Inflatable Arm Flailing Tube Man! Hi, I'm Al Harrington President and CEO of Al Harrington's Wacky Waving Inflatable Arm Flailing Tube Man emporium and warehouse. Thanks to a shipping error I am now currently overstocked on Wacky Waving Inflatable Arm Flailing Tube Men and I am passing the savings on to you!... Attract customers to your business. Make a splash at your next presentation. Keep grandma company protect your crops confuse your neighbors. African American? Hail a cab. Testify in church or just raise the roof! Whatever your Wacky Waving Inflatable Arm Flailing Tube Man needs are. So come on down to Wacky Waving Inflatable Arm Flailing Tube Man emporium and warehouse. Route 2 in Weekapaug.

scripts.name: The Simpsons
scripts.copyright: © 1989–present Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation. All rights reserved.
scripts.title: Steamed Hams

lines.text: [Chalmers rings Skinner's doorbell while at the exterior. On the other hand at the interior Skinner opens the door.]
Well, Seymour, I made it, despite your directions.
Ah, Superintendent Chalmers, welcome! I hope you're prepared for an unforgettable luncheon!

[Chalmers enters. In the dining room, he sits at the table by using a brown chair and places a bottle in an ice bucket, while Skinner runs to the kitchen, only to find his roast is burnt, and gasps in horror.]
Oh, ye gods! My roast is ruined!
[Skinner peers out of the window and sees a Krusty Burger across the street.]
But what if... I were to purchase fast food and disguise it as my own cooking? [chuckles] Delightfully devilish, Seymour.
[Skinner removes his apron, opens the window and begins to climb through, but Chalmers enters the kitchen and catches Skinner trying to leave.]
Ehhh
[ ... Skinner, with his crazy explanations... The superintendent's gonna need his medication .... When he hears Skinner's lame exaggerations, There'll be trouble in town - tonight!.... ]
SEEEEEEEEEYMOOUUURRR!......
Superintendent Chalmers, I was just uhhh stretching my calfs on the windo sill. Isometric excersize, care to join me?
Why is there smoke coming out of your oven Seymour?
Oh, that isn't smoke, that's steam from the steamed clams we're having. Mmm steamed clams!
[Chalmers exits the room to the kitchen.]
Phew!
[We see Skinner scampering off to Krusty Burger.]
[Skinner enters the kitchen with a trey of Krusty Burgers.]
Superintendent, I hope you're ready for mouth watering hamburgers!
I thought you said we we're having steamed clams.
Oh no, I said 'steamed hams'! , that's what I call hamburgers.
You call hamburgers 'steamed hams'?
Yes! It's a regional dialect.
Uh-huh. Eh, what region?
Upstate New York?
Really? Well, I'm from Utica and I've never heard anyone use the phrase 'steamed hams'.
Oh, not in Utica, no. It's an Albany expression.
I see.
[Chalmers takes a bite out of a burger and chews it a little, while Skinner sips his drink.]
You know, these hamburgers are quite similar to the ones they have at Krusty Burger.
[chuckles] Oh, no! Patented Skinner Burgers! Old family recipe.
For steamed hams?
Yes.
Yes, and you call them steamed hams, despite the fact they are obviously grilled.
Y- Uh.. you know, the... One thing I should... Excuse me for one second.
Of course.
[Skinner enters and leaves the kitchen swiftly upon seeing it is now on fire]
[Pretends to Yawns] Well, that was wonderful. A good time was had by all. I'm pooped.
Yes, I really should be-- GOOD LORD, WHAT IS HAPPENING IN THERE!?
Aurora Borealis?
AURORA BOREALIS!? AT THIS TIME OF YEAR, AT THIS TIME OF DAY, IN THIS PART OF THE COUNTRY, LOCALIZED ENTIRELY WITHIN YOUR KITCHEN!?
Yes!
May I see it?
No.
SEYMOUR!!! THE HOUSE IS ON FIRE!!!
No, mother, it's just the Northern Lights.
Well, Seymour, you are an odd fellow, but I must say... you steam a good ham.
HELP!!! HEEEELP!!!

scripts.name: Rick and Morty
scripts.copyright: © Adult Swim / Cartoon Network. All rights reserved.
scripts.title: Two Brothers

lines.text: It's in theaters now! Coming this summer: Two brothers. In a van. And then a meteor hit. And they ran as fast as they could, from giant cat monsters. And then a giant tornado came. And that's when things got knocked into 12th gear.... A Mexican armada shows up. With weapons made from Two--tomatoes. And you better bet your bottom dollar that these two brothers know how to handle business. In: Alien Invasion Tomato Monster Mexican Armada Brothers, Who Are Just Regular Brothers, Running In a Van From an Asteroid and All Sorts of Things THE MOVIE! Hold on, there's more! Old women are coming, and they're also in the movie, and they're gonna come, and cross-attack these two brothers. But let's get back to the brothers, because they're-- they have a strong bond. You don't want to know about it here, but I'll tell you one thing: The moon, it comes crashing into Earth. And what do you do then? It's two brothers and--and th-they're - It's called Two Brothers. Two brothers! It's just called Two Brothers.

scripts.title: Ants In My Eyes

lines.text: I'm Ants-In-My-Eyes Johnson, Here at Ants-in-My-Eyes Johnson's Electronics. I mean, there's so many ants in my eyes! And there's so many TVs, microwaves, radios I think, I can't-- I'm not 100% sure what we have here in stock, because I can't see anything. Our prices, I hope, aren't too low! Check out this refrigerator! Only $200! What about this microwave? Only $100! That's fair! I'm Ants-in-My-Eyes Johnson! Everything's black, I can't see a thing! And also I can't feel anything either-- did I mention that? But that's not as catchy as having ants in your eyes. So that always goes, you know, off by the wayside. I can't feel. It's a very rare disease. All my sens-- All my nerves, they don't allow for the sensation of touch. So I never know what's going on. Am I standing? Sitting? I don't know.

scripts.name: Rick and Morty
scripts.copyright: © Adult Swim / Cartoon Network. All rights reserved.
scripts.title: Real Fake Doors!

lines.text: Hey, are you tired of real doors, cluttering up your house, where you open 'em, and they actually go somewhere? And you go in another room? Get on down to Real Fake Doors! That's us. Fill a whole room up with 'em. See? Watch, check this out! Won't open. Won't open. Not this one, not this one. None of 'em open! FakeDoors (dot) com is our website, so check it out for a lot of really great deals on fake doooooooors!.
[The Salesman walks off the set, still looking at the camera. He gets into he car and starts driving]
Hey, wait a minute, Rick. Wh-- I thought this was a commercial. Wh-what's going on? I mean--
Relax, Morty. Don't-don't worry about it. Let's just just see where this goes.
[The Salesman is now stuck in traffic.]
Step on it, we all got places to be!  Son of a bitch!
[The Salesman pulls into a driveway]
See, that must be where he lives. OK...
[The Salesman starts making himself a peanut butter and jelly sandwich]
Huh. Making himself a sandwich now...
Hey everybody! So this is my house, I just made a sandwich, peanut butter and jelly, still here, still selling fake doors!
What?
Oh my god, it's still the commerical!
We have fake doors like you wouldn't believe! What are you worried about? Come get fake doors. Call us up, and order some fake doors today. Don't even hesitate, Don't even worry and don't even...
I'm bored, change it.
No wait Rick, Hold on hold on...

give it a second thought. That's our slogan. See it on the bottom of the screen, below our name. Here's another slogan, right below that one. What are you worried about? Come get fake doors! Get in here quick, get out quicker, with an arm of fake doors in you arms. Don't even worry about it!
Okay you can change it.
